newsitem.title: UK: FOCUS-Rolls-Royce wins $500 mln Trent order.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS-Rolls-Royce wins $500 mln Trent order.

text.p: British aero-engine firm Rolls-Royce Plc said on Monday it had won a $500 million order for Trent 700 turbofans from Emirates Airlines to power its new fleet of Airbus A330-200 aircraft.
The airline ordered 16 A330s and took options on a further seven of the twin-engined wide-body aircraft from Airbus last year. Deliveries are due to begin in January 1999.

Rolls said the deal makes Emirates one of its biggest airline customers and follows an order by the Dubai-based carrier for its Trent 800 engines to power a fleet of seven longer-range Boeing 777 twinjets which it started flying last year.

The order was applauded by the British government which said it meant Rolls had now won more than a third of sales in the "big twins" market for engines to power Boeing 777 and Airbus A330 aircraft, against U.S. rivals General Electric and United Technologies unit Pratt & Whitney.
"This is excellent news for Rolls-Royce and for many other British companies in the supply chain," Trade and Industry minister Ian Lang said in a statement.
"A contract of this size indicates very clearly that British industry -- and British engineering -- can compete with the world's best in an increasingly global market place."
"Eleven airlines...have already bought Trents, giving Rolls-Royce a market share of about 35 per cent," he said.
